page.title: 16MILNGAVIE WATER WORKS
page.content: {Mugdock}and{Craigmaddie }resevoirs supply water for the city of Glasgow. Mugdock resevoir was opened in 1859 and Craigmaddie resevoir 37 years later.The water for these resevoirs is brought by a pipeline for 25 miles from Loch Katrine. We visited these resevoirs and found it a nice place for walking. There were lovely flower gardens and trees by the resevoirs and we noticed a sign saying "Exhibition".Inside there were pictures showing you the history of the water works and how,in olden days this lovely clean water was so much needed.Dirty drinking water often caused cholera outbreaks. As we were leaving, we looked at a statue of the engineer of the water works and drank some of the delicious water.
